timeline.bodyText: This feels wrong - this should call down to LockWatchEventCacheImpl or NoOpLockWatchEventCache.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: Oh I see - you went with an approach entirely through the proxy. I'm not sure I like that really - surely the logic is 100x cleaner just by doing what you originally said, i.e. having LWECI return true and NOLWEC return false?
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: do you mind expanding this test with hasMessage as there are a number of exceptions under that class (I know I am guilty of this too, but in an effort to make it clearer what we are testing, this should be done).
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: Nope, ResilientLockWatchEventCache has just one from what I can see?
replies.author: jkozlowski

replies.bodyText: Ah yea, I see you're just throwing a generic exception instead of actually causing a legit exception inside LWECI.
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText:
Why is this necessary? Also, if we're going to default to anything, wouldn't it be better to be false? I still think this should just be:
boolean isEnabled;
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: I don’t think it matters, I just went with this approach.
replies.author: jkozlowski

replies.bodyText: I still think we should not set this - I'd rather never, ever have to debug another bug like that auto-delegate, and while I know this is very different, it's just less error-prone to not set a default.
replies.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: (I know you have a test for it, but still).
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: I don't really like this - I much prefer just implementing in LWECI and NOLWEC as I feel it is less error prone, and doing this kind of proxy-wrangling is abusing the whole point of it IMO.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S
